meanings.definition: To use technical or specialized language
meanings.sent1: The professor jargonized the lecture, making it hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: She always jargonized her explanations, confusing her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The manual was jargonized to the point where even experts struggled to comprehend it.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer jargonized the contract, turning a simple agreement into a maze of words.
meanings.sent5: The scientist jargonized the research findings, leaving the audience bewildered.

meanings.definition: Made difficult to understand by the use of jargon
meanings.sent1: The jargonized document left the readers scratching their heads.
meanings.sent2: The jargonized report was a challenge for anyone without a technical background.
meanings.sent3: The jargonized presentation led to more questions than answers.
meanings.sent4: The jargonized language in the manual made it nearly impossible for beginners to use.
meanings.sent5: The jargonized terms in the article created a barrier for entry to new readers.
